ReplayMem

Base class should only implement the interface Difference between different child class is what is stored in samples(the transition index only or the pair of state) Number of Transitions must be even agent = makeAgent("AgentFDQN", env, conf) has incorporated environment into Agent. mkInst can be modified to do preprocessing to state.old usage: AgentBase:Observe() ins = self$mem$mkInst(state.old = state.old, action = action, reward = reward, state.new = state.new, done = done, info = list(episode = episode, stepidx = stepidx, info = info)) self$mem$add(ins)

ReplayMemIndex

no need to remap the replayed.idx since

ReplayMemPng

indx = agent$mem$replayed.idx replay.samples = agent$mem$samples[indx] x = replay.samples[[2]] image = x$state.old image = x$state.new agent$env$showImage(image[,,1]) agent$env$showImage(image[,,2])

ReplayMemUniformStack

States are stored sequencially, s_1,s_2,....s_N where N is the capacity The replay memory size is always even number since transitions s_i to s_i+1 contain 2 states. For Uniform Stack, since s_i,s_i+1 are stacked to form a new state which introduces another level of complexity States should be stored in unit form 0-128 to represent enough information and converted back to float again Note that normalized float can not be converted to int since they reduces either to -1 or +1, which is binarize the image!!! ins = self$mem$mkInst(state.old = state.old, action = action, reward = reward, state.new = state.new, done = done, info = list(episode = episode, stepidx = stepidx, info = info)) self$mem$add(ins)
